title: Dracula
prev_sentence: Again I could not but notice his prodigious strength.
next_sentence: Then he took out my traps, and placed them on the ground beside me as I stood close to a great door, old and studded with large iron nails, and set in a projecting doorway of massive stone.

question: It seems to me that the further east you go the more unpunctual are the [MASK].
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: I had to hurry breakfast, for the train started a little before eight, or rather it ought to have done so, for after rushing to the station at 7:30 I had to sit in the carriage for more than an hour before we began to move.
next_sentence: What ought they to be in China?

question: Cannot eat, cannot [MASK], so diary instead.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: Seward's Diary.  (Kept in phonograph)  25 May.--Ebb tide in appetite to-day.
next_sentence: Since my rebuff of yesterday I have a sort of empty feeling; nothing in the world seems of sufficient importance to be worth the doing.... As I knew that the only cure for this sort of thing was work, I went down amongst the patients.

question: Some change had [MASK] over her body.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: I went back to the room, and found Van Helsing looking at poor Lucy, and his face was sterner than ever.
next_sentence: Death had given back part of her beauty, for her brow and cheeks had recovered some of their flowing lines; even the lips had lost their deadly pallor.

question: All yesterday we travel, ever getting [MASK] to the mountains, and moving into a more and more wild and desert land.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: 5 November, morning.--Let me be accurate in everything, for though you and I have seen some strange things together, you may at the first think that I, Van Helsing, am mad--that the many horrors and the so long strain on nerves has at the last turn my brain.
next_sentence: There are great, frowning precipices and much falling water, and Nature seem to have held sometime her carnival.

question: It almost seems as though the captain had been seized with some kind of mania before he had got [MASK] into blue water, and that this had developed persistently throughout the voyage.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: As there is no motive for concealment, I am permitted to use them, and accordingly send you a rescript, simply omitting technical details of seamanship and supercargo.
next_sentence: Of course my statement must be taken cum grano, since I am writing from the dictation of a clerk of the Russian consul, who kindly translated for me, time being short.

question: Death had given back part of her beauty, for her brow and cheeks had recovered some of their flowing [MASK]; even the lips had lost their deadly pallor.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: Some change had come over her body.
next_sentence: It was as if the blood, no longer needed for the working of the heart, had gone to make the harshness of death as little rude as might be.

question: [MASK] the madness of fright was not to them, so that they could break away.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: And then the horses cowered lower and lower, and moaned in terror as men do in pain.
next_sentence: I feared for my dear Madam Mina when these weird figures drew near and circled round.

question: He had heard him yell; and when he went to him found him [MASK] on his face on the floor, all covered with blood.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: He is now seemingly quiet for a spell.... Is he?---- That wild yell seemed to come from his room....                                       The attendant came bursting into my room and told me that Renfield had somehow met with some accident.
next_sentence: I must go at once....     CHAPTER XXI  DR. SEWARD'S DIARY   3 October.--Let me put down with exactness all that happened, as well as I can remember it, since last I made an entry.

question: Here and there was a peasant [MASK] or woman kneeling before a shrine, who did not even turn round as we approached, but seemed in the self-surrender of devotion to have neither eyes nor ears for the outer world.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: By the roadside were many crosses, and as we swept by, my companions all crossed themselves.
next_sentence: There were many things new to me: for instance, hay-ricks in the trees, and here and there very beautiful masses of weeping birch, their white stems shining like silver through the delicate green of the leaves.

question: Wait you with me outside, [MASK] and unheard, and things much stranger are yet to be.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: So far there is much that is strange.
next_sentence: So"--here he shut the dark slide of his lantern--"now to the outside."

question: It has always been late in the evening when they have been [MASK], and on two occasions the children have not been found until early in the following morning.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: In all these cases the children were too young to give any properly intelligible account of themselves, but the consensus of their excuses is that they had been with a "bloofer lady."
next_sentence: It is generally supposed in the neighbourhood that, as the first child missed gave as his reason for being away that a "bloofer lady" had asked him to come for a walk, the others had picked up the phrase and used it as occasion served.

question: We all four went into the room, but none of the others at first [MASK] anything.
title: Dracula
prev_sentence: There was an unusual understanding of himself, which was unlike anything I had ever met with in a lunatic; and he took it for granted that his reasons would prevail with others entirely sane.
next_sentence: His request was that I would at once release him from the asylum and send him home.
